creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
When using custom jsp tags, the compiler fails to generate
proper java code in the generated servlet for the JspRuntimeLibrary.introspecthelper
method. For example <cqt:ForEach group="<%=test.getCount()%>" yields the generated code JspRuntimeLibrary.introspecthelper(_jspx_th_cqt_ForEach_2, "group","<%=test.getCount()%>",null,null, false);
instead of JspRuntimeLibrary.introspecthelper(_jspx_th_cqt_ForEach_2, "group","3",null,null, false);
"3" being the runtime evaluted result from the test.getCount() call. In this example "test" is the id of a jsp:useBean
call previoulsy made. The result of this example yields a
NumberFormatException when it trys to call the setGroup method on tag class.

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
JSP Spec section 2.12.1 describes request-time attribute value.  Jasper 
currently does not implement this correctly.  
The fix won't be available in time for Tomcat 3.2.2.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Unlikely for 3.3, probably after a jasper refactoring.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
The only time JspRuntimeLibrary.introspecthelper() is called for a Tag
attribute in Tomcat 3.1 is when <rtexprvalue> in the tld is set to false.
In this case, "<%=test.getCount()%>" isn't a valid value.  What is needed is
better error handling.
